metadata.Title: CVE-2018-3639 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
Systems with microprocessors utilizing speculative execution andspeculative execution of memory reads before the addresses of all priormemory writes are known may allow unauthorized disclosure of information toan attacker with local user access via a side-channel analysis, akaSpeculative Store Bypass (SSB), Variant 4.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-3639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-4.4.0-127-lowlatency - 4.4.0-127.153

linux-image-4.4.0-127-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-127.153
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-127-generic - 4.4.0-127.153
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-127.153').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1091.99').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1094.99').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1060.69').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-43.48~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1018.21').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1017.21').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1026.31').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oem package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1028.31').
qemu package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.5+dfsg-5ubuntu10.29').
libvirt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.1-1ubuntu10.24').
intel-microcode package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20180807a.0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
xen package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
